issue.title: Clarify span iterator and const_iterator behavior

discussion.p: There are multiple issues with how span specifies its iterators:

li.p: The relationship between iterator and const_iterator isn't specified. (span isn't a container, so it doesn't receive this automatically.)
The iterators should be specified to be constexpr.

discussion.p: By imitating /3 "All requirements on container iterators ([container.requirements]) apply to basic_string_view::const_iterator as well.", we can specify that iterator is convertible to const_iterator.
discussion.note: 2018-04-23 Moved to Tentatively Ready after 6 positive votes on c++std-lib.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4741.

blockquote.p: -4- The iterator types for span is a random access iterator and a contiguous iteratorspan::iterator and span::const_iterator are random access iterators (), contiguous iterators (), and constexpr iterators (). All requirements on container iterators () apply to span::iterator and span::const_iterator as well.
